intro: Thulinella chrysantha, commonly known as the golden thulinella, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
